title: How to Play Pocket Tanks

steps.headline: Launch the game.
steps.description: A copy can be found in the external links at the bottom of the page.

steps.headline: Set your options.
steps.description: The easiest way to start is to set explosion kick, etc to medium, and turn wind off.

steps.headline: Start a game, and try to select the best weapons.
steps.description: These are loosely based on your play style and opinion, however, these weapons are very powerful: Fire in the Hole, Mega-Nuke, Cannon Ball, and Chaos Grenade. If you choose to use burying weapons such as Mud Pie and Dirtball, be sure to grab any weapons they could use to counteract it such as Mountain Mover or Dirt Mover. They will then be forced to get negative points by hurting themselves to dig out. Try to use these weapons near your 8th to 9th volley.

steps.headline: Master shooting at high angles.
steps.description: Try aiming one degree from 90 (straight up) and using full power. 89 degrees and full power will yield a shot that flies high off the screen and lands a very short distance in front of you. Experiment with different degrees.

steps.headline: Point straight at your opponent if you have a clear shot and use full power, or maybe a little above them to counteract gravity's force.

text: Launch the game. A copy can be found in the external links at the bottom of the page. Set your options. The easiest way to start is to set explosion kick, etc to medium, and turn wind off. Start a game, and try to select the best weapons. These are loosely based on your play style and opinion, however, these weapons are very powerful: Fire in the Hole, Mega-Nuke, Cannon Ball, and Chaos Grenade. If you choose to use burying weapons such as Mud Pie and Dirtball, be sure to grab any weapons they could use to counteract it such as Mountain Mover or Dirt Mover. They will then be forced to get negative points by hurting themselves to dig out. Try to use these weapons near your 8th to 9th volley. Master shooting at high angles. Try aiming one degree from 90 (straight up) and using full power. 89 degrees and full power will yield a shot that flies high off the screen and lands a very short distance in front of you. Experiment with different degrees. Point straight at your opponent if you have a clear shot and use full power, or maybe a little above them to counteract gravity's force.
